intro: Croton portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican croton, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive sap and colorful foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a glossy green surface with prominent veins. The flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by colorful bracts that attract pollinators.
